title: The problem with ADCs is they do too much damage full stop
body:
So, everyone is complaining about ADCs and supports right now, and I'm seeing a lot of ideas being floated around. People talking about "counterplay" like making ADCs have skillshot auto attacks and other silly stuff like that. I'm really against this, I think reliable damage, just like point and click CC, has an important place in the game. 

I think the problem with ADCs is that currently, they simply do the most damage in the game full stop. Their damage values are absolutely fucking incredible. The ADC is the team's source of sieging and ranged DPS. They should do the most effective damage in a game because their damage is:
1) reliable. auto attacks don't miss.
2) safe. ADCs with peel are extremely difficult to catch and deliver all of their damage from a place of safety because they're ranged.
3) constant. ADCs have 100% uptime on their access to their DPS because they do 90% of their damage with auto attacks.

ADCs should have moderate damage values that work out to the highest effective damage in the game _only when played well_ because they deliver constant damage without downtime. The problem is ADCs are doing literally more damage than a mage or assassin does with their entire rotation using only auto attacks and their steroid. I see a lot of people describing ADC damage output as "burst per second", which I think is apt. Riot just did a huge assassin pass last year that loaded up assassins with all kinds of gates and delays on their damage (which you can potentially dodge in addition to this), but later in the game an ADC can kill squishies and even fighters or off-tanks in 1-2 seconds, no questions asked. melee champs can be seen closing the gap between them and an ADC as a melee champion, successfully getting on top of them, the supposed success condition in a melee versus ranged encounter, and they'll just die regardless because the ADC bursts them with their autos alone. 

ADC play patterns aren't the problem (that said, ADCs with conditionally gated damage like Caitlyn's DPS skyrocketing when she consistently lands Es and aims at people trapped by W is still preferably to strictly right click ADCs. Kog'Maw for instance actively avoids using his damaging abilities in a skirmish because they negatively affect his DPS from strictly auto attacking), their damage is simply too high full stop. It trivializes the DPS aspect of the role because they essentially become assassins with 100% uptime.

My personal opinion on the matter is that the game that was built at the beginning with: 
Burst > Sustained > Tank > Burst was one that worked. 

It also has costs, namely people dying instantly with very little counterplay. 

When we changed unconditional burst to not be a viable strategy (think old LB, old Rengar), we also removed one of the checks for ADC's. On the flip side, mages are now more sustained damage threats in themselves (since their power is translated) and can rival ADC's in mid game as well. 

Ultimately, we could give sustained AP the best late game scaling (as champs that can miss), but it is not a trivial problem space and there are a lot of run-on problems from solves in this space. 

Needless to say, we certainly hear you and something we debate about on a regular basis and are not particularly happy with, but again it is a large and difficult project.

> On the flip side, mages are now more sustained damage threats in themselves

The issue here is that mages can never put out the amount of sustained damage that ADCs can, since their itemization and stats simply cant support this. Also most mages cant support such a pattern on their kits.

Remember when mages were the main source of burst on the game? Before neutering AP totals and killing AP itemization?

Yeah mage itemization simply doesn't support scaling as well as AD itemization

Max DPS multiplier to the base stat (AP/AD)
AP  X CDR (45%) ---> AP X 1.81 (assuming all abilities scale with CDR and there is also Deathcap but that just adds to the total AP which is seen in game)
AD X AS X Crit ----> AD X 6.25

Lets see Cassiopeia has most of her power in her E which is kind of like an auto attack.... with her basic abilities Cassiopeia deals up to 1.1 X AP as DPS and with the DPS multipliers we get 1.748 X AP  (assuming 100% up time on Q and spamming E off cooldown with 45% CDR and about 50% up time on W which is probably a bit unrealistic)

Which does give Cassiopeia at least somewhat competitive damage actually (800 AP would be about equal to an ADC with 300 AD + 2.0 AS + 80% Crit with IE) though to be fair she would use around 193 mana each second to spam her E with 45% CDR and that's not counting the mana for her other abilities and the requirement of hitting Q so it is still rather off (getting to 800 AP +45% CDR would probably require full build)
Don't forget Adaptive Helm removes the very notion of AP DPS mages.

They have the longest effective range of any damage dealer with anywhere closer to their raw damage out put, and are only beaten by siege mages elsewise.  Additionally, they also have gap closers/escapes, or plenty of hard and soft CC, and in some cases stealth and outright untargetability/invulnerability to keep them safe.  On top of this, none of their damage can miss, or be outplayed while also costing literally nothing from them, and having no range penalties at all-- I mean, in most games, ranged get less value out of AD, or crit, or attack speed, and especially lifesteal/life leach type effects and there is next to none of that in League, and their base stats are also extremely close and more than made up for by built in steroids.  If that still wasn't enough, they have no turn speed so they can kite better and more easily than in other MOBAs, and they face no penalty for directly engaging in melee combat, which allows them to sit still and often drain tank or outright kill melee carries, assassins juggernauts, divers and skirmishers who successfully close on the marksman in question without even having to kite.

They have their cake, and half the cake their team is supposed to enjoy (including almost all of the support's) and they're eating it too.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

And who said anything about not alienating existing players? If they make a dramatic change that vastly alters the meta to the point where adc is no longer a valued component in the game, then you're alienating everyone who plays those champions AND everyone who likes the current meta.

When making vast changes that alter the viability of entire roles like people have been hinting at, they have to tread carefully and be sure of their changes to avoid ruining the game entirely. Imagine if they changed it so that jungling was optional, and in fact suboptimal. Imagine how jungling mains and people who liked solo top or mid would feel?

The problem is not JUST ardent censer. The problem is that ADCs are too high sustained damage. This is not a problem that can be fixed by changing one item. It's a systemic issue, and one that is not easy to adjust.

ADCs have never, in ANY meta, not been valuable. The closest they have ever come to that was the tank meta, where, guess what? They were still as valuable as any other role because nobody could take objectives like an ADC. And objectives win the game.

They just weren't the most important role in everything, so ADC players bitched and moaned -_-

Not that the tank meta was magically problem-free, I am aware how bad it was for assassins back then for one thing, but at least you didn't have to rely on one person for everything.

Also, what do feelings have to do with balance? When it comes to a COMPETITIVE GAME, balance matters. Feelings do not matter in the slightest.

One role is the main protagonist and no one else matters and that role gets all the gold and exp and kills and you have to die for him/her and if yours dies you lose and their's dies they lose etc. This isn't fun anymore.

"wow im feeling good about my build right no.. oh adc is here.. better go and dive this so he can get some kills and i can got to grey screen.. yay this is fun.."

What needs to change is that ADC's need to be less extreme. If they have peel and a coordinated team then they are gods and if they don't then they're just dead weight or food for the enemy team. They need to have their inherent survivability go up and their damage potential go down.

> On the flip side, mages are now more sustained damage threats in themselves (since their power is translated) and can rival ADC's in mid game as well.

Let me ask you this: what mages have you seen at Worlds?

Ryze, Cass, Taliyah, Syndra, Orianna

The first 3 are DPS mages with *extremely* sort cooldowns on their damaging spells, then you've got Ms. Outplay herself as a burst mage with long range stun option, then you've got Utility/AoE Burst. 

You don't see other mages because they *don't* do the sustained damage or burst damage of these five, not with any reliability or safety anyway.

well, syndra and orianan also have rather high dps for mages with insanely low cd on their Qs....the only two mages with more dps that we don't see at worlds are azir and aurelion(and maybe victor), and i really wouldn't be supprised if they come out in the knockout stage.

The currrent state pof the game just favours Ranged dps, wether it's AD or AP because burst has been nerfed directly and indirectly alot in the past to a point where ranged dps are rather save and diveing melees are near usless if not snowballing hard. Part of the issue is overall damage creep which causes dps to turn into 'burst per second' and allows them to take down any squishy that gets cought by cc witout the need of an burst focused champ.

Ignoring the fact that we hated Elise, Diana, Akali and Rumble for **years** and these champions regularly had to get nerfed whenever they got too popular because tanks didn't have any sustained MR options.

And ignoring the fact that assassins no longer have their instant death fantasy fulfilled, instead either having this weird "stalk your prey" notion or just flat out not feeling like assassins at all {{champion:7}} .

And ignoring the fact that having sustained AP champions in a world with {{item:3194}} and sustained damage carries who have sustain, semi-burst with critical strikes, and better sieging than AP champions...

What is the point of this? Why is it good for the game? Yes, there is no longer a proper answer to the problem of ADCs. Yes, there are a lot of run-on problems from solutions in this space, and yes, you are going to need to rework Ryze for the fifth goddamn time because of all of this. 

Syndra is a champion that is literally based on "UNTAPPED POWER!"

And what about AP assassins? This nonsense where you don't actually increase counterplay, you just arbitrarily tack on a "loading time" to their point and click damage ({{champion:105}} Seastone Trident/{{champion:91}} Passive/{{champion:55}} Preparation/{{champion:7}} passive, that's not fun for anyone. I do not understand why you could release Ekko and then think that this assassin update was a good idea. 

Just...Right now, assassins are basically less tanky, slightly more mobile divers. And I do mean slightly, because divers are very fucking mobile. There is very little class distinction right now. A tiny fraction. Is this what you wanted?

This extreme though was born the moment when surviving a burst window would allow players (especially AD characters) to gain back almost all of their HP negating thus the value of the burst.

What I would take a look at is the spreading of self sustain and self heals/life stealing. There is so much around through items that you can easily see Gragas getting from 20% to 100% in 2 seconds out of combat (Warmog and 1-2 Ocean dragon buffs) and while it looks funny to watch I don't think this is really healthy. The same way you see ADCs able to lifesteal back 60% of their HP in 2 Autos while also being at range and with the tools to kite.

I think that heavy healing should be limited to healer characters and characters that rely on self sustain as a chore mechanic (think of Vlad). This way we can have back fights where being wounded (aka not at 100% HP) doesn't mean that you can't engage because you'll be deleted and we can rebelance burst windows not to be 100-to-0 oneshots.

IMO the problem has always been that ADCs do too much damage *to squishy targets*. They need to have the level of damage they have now in order to be able to threaten tanks appropriately, which they do quite well.  

If there were some way to reduce their overall damage but preserve their damage versus tanks, that seems like it would solve a lot of the issues people have with them. Unfortunately you can't really do that by changing a single item because then that item would just become situational. It kind of needs to be a change to one of the underlying mechanics they rely on. Since nerfing defensive items *and* nerfing ADC items would result in tanks being a lot worse, it seems like the best place to start would be reworking Critical Strike Chance into a stat that still gives strong sustained damage but isn't as randomly bursty.

"It also has costs, namely people dying instantly with very little counterplay."

I disagree so much with this... That only happens because damage is too high across the board. You can have the same hierarchy without having instabursts.

You would have to nerf sustain, of course, but after that, you could have a world where a burst champion's full combo leaves the adc low and it becomes very dangerous to stick around, as you don't recover all your hp in 2 seconds, as it is now.

Lowering overall damage allows for burst champions to be buffed to compensate for the lack of one shots, which makes them feel more bursty by comparison, despite being less bursty. Also, it would make teamfights and fights in general longer, allowing for more skill expression and fun.

Then supports and defensive strategies are generally stronger since you have longer to peel enemies off of you, which is STILL a net buff to tanks since they have longer to be healed. You'd effectively make assassins and divers worse since they just throw out their rotation and sit there with nothing else to do. Just now realizing, you'd also make catcher supports worse since it's easier for enchanters to just shield off damage now that there's less damage to shield.
